Package org.ejbca.util

Class JDBCUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ejbca.util.JDBCUtil
  • public class JDBCUtil
extends Object
    Utility methods for jdbc calls.

    close() methods do not close quietly but log errors (exceptions) as warning. Closing quietly could mask potential errors that could have no impact depending on GC stress conditions, or simply exhaust database resources, so it is better to have some warning than nothing at all.

    Version:
    $Id: JDBCUtil.java 24766 2016-11-18 13:12:02Z jeklund $

                   throws Exception

      • getDataSource

        public static DataSource getDataSource()
                                throws ServiceLocatorException
        Return the requested datasource name. It assumes that the dsName returns a reference (java.lang.String) to the real datasource instance, otherwise you're likely to get a ClassCastException.
        Returns:
        the requested datasource
        Throws:
        ServiceLocatorException - if there is an error locating the datasource

      • getDataSourceOrNull

        public static DataSource getDataSourceOrNull()
        Return the requested datasource name. It assumes that the dsName returns a reference (java.lang.String) to the real datasource instance, otherwise you're likely to get a ClassCastException.
        Returns:
        the requested datasource or null if it could not be located

      • getDBConnection

        public static Connection getDBConnection()
                                  throws ServiceLocatorException
        return a requested database connection
        Returns:
        a database connection
        Throws:
        ServiceLocatorException - if it cannot get the datasource connection
        See Also:
        getDataSource()

      • close

        public static void close​(Connection con,
                         PreparedStatement ps,
                         ResultSet rs)
        Close a connection, prepared statement and result set, logging potential closing errors as warning.
        Parameters:
        con - the connection to close (can be null)
        ps - the prepared statement to close (can be null)
        rs - the result set to close (can be null)

      • columnExists

        public static boolean columnExists​(Connection con,
                                   String table,
                                   String col)
        Check if a certain column exists in the database.
        Parameters:
        con - the connection to use, not closed by this method
        table - the table where the column perhaps exists
        col - the name of the column to check for
        Returns:
        true if the column exists, falst if not (the database throws an SQLException)
